intro: Coleus petersianus, commonly known as the purple heart plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its vibrant, colorful foliage with shades of red, purple, and green. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in whorls at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are often heart-shaped, hence the common name, and are known for their striking visual appeal. Coleus petersianus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
